title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1647-6.5 - Contracts payable
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1647-6.5 - Contracts payable

State Regulations

Commitments made by a local agency in connection with
contracts whose costs are to be charged to operating expense or replacement
reserve shall be recorded in account 1500A, Incompleted Contracts--Management, and account 2400A, Contract Awards--Management. The method of recording
contract awards, contract changes and partial payments is similar to that
described in sections
1646-5.2, 1646- 5.3 and 1646-5.4
for the development period. At the end of each reporting period, a journal
voucher shall be prepared charging the appropriate operating expense account
and crediting account 2119, Sundry Accounts Payable, and also charging account
2400A. Contract Awards--Management, and crediting account 1500A, Incompleted

Contracts--Management, with the total amount of any unpaid approved periodic
estimates for partial payment on hand. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1647-6.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
